com.qualcomm.hardware

Class HardwareDeviceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DeviceManager
      • com.qualcomm.hardware.HardwareDeviceManager

  • public class HardwareDeviceManager
extends DeviceManager
    Scan for, and create instances of, Modern Robotics USB devices

    • Method Detail

      • scanForUsbDevices

        public java.util.Map<SerialNumber,DeviceManager.DeviceType> scanForUsbDevices()
                                                                       throws RobotCoreException
        Description copied from class: DeviceManager
        Get a listing of all Modern Robotics devices connected.

        This method will attempt to open all USB devices that are using an FTDI USB chipset. It will then probe the device to determine if it is a Modern Robotics device. Finally, it will close the device.

        Because of the opening and closing of devices, it is recommended that this method is not called while any FTDI devices are in use.

        Specified by:
        scanForUsbDevices in class DeviceManager
        Returns:
        a map of serial numbers to Modern Robotics device types
        Throws:
        RobotCoreException - if unable to open a device
